title: older man seeks UCSC/Cabrillo undergrad
text:
Welcome. Thanks for opening my ad.

You are already weird in a nice way since you're looking at Craigslist ads (yes, people really did used to meet this way!) in a most retro fashion. I'd have expected you to be glued to Facebook, Tinder, Instagram, or some other smartphone app, and not to have much time for old-fashioned words typed on a screen.

But, apart from your willingness to meet someone via CL, or at least be entertained by the ads (hopefully you are not just doing a research project), just how weird are you?

Namely, did you notice the "51" that was also part of my ad? Yes, I am more than twice your age. I suspect you didn't notice that, so there's your warning not to read further.

Indeed, I want a friendship, and hopefully sexual relationship, with someone "scandalously" younger. What can I say: I love Nabokov; I love being a teacher as well as a student, I'd like to find a muse or a mentor as well as being one; I think power disparities (youth and beauty vs. "wisdom") are fascinating; I think a relationship that is a conspiracy a deux and that everyone else in the world disapproves of is hot.

The odds of finding this are minimal, I know. But, I've corresponded enough with those your age to know there are girls who share the dream. Especially, for some reason, at UCSC. (There's something about slugs -- ha!) 

One or two I came close to meeting, but for those particular individuals I failed the looks test (damn digital cameras!). I think I'm not bad-looking, and I have a nice smile; I'm tall (6' 2 1/2") and have blue eyes and shaggy brown hair. That said, you're dealing with a character actor, not a leading man, so to speak ...

I'm a writer, editor, and photographer, and most interested in hanging out with an artistic or musical girl. Scientists can be sexy too, and anyhow beggars like me can't be choosers, so just bring what you have.

I grew up almost friendless and being called queer throughout school. I didn't have any relationships at all until I was older than you are. Late bloomer. 

Now, I'm boringly hetero (though adventurous within that -- I don't like conventional sex roles and stereotypes) but certainly queer-friendly. I do have a bi woman friend who'd play with us both and is much closer to your age, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.

I madly love most types of music, though leaning more toward classical, trad jazz, some classic rock, lots of woman singer-songwriters, Sinatra and the rat pack. 

I like good beer and cocktails, plus single-malt whiskies, though at the moment I'm enduring a low carb diet (sigh). Good weed is an occasional pleasure, though a lot less than I used to. I'd also try molly -- or whatever they're calling it these days -- again if I knew it was legit. But, I'd rather enhance my life by looking at you and listening to your voice than via chemicals.

I'm not sure what to add, given that likely I'm whistling in the wind anyhow. But just in case I'm also whispering in your ear, well, I'll post this and perhaps refine it later.

I expect replies from the auto-spammers, as well as from the brigade of immature guys who like to pose as girls and fuck with people who dared to put their head up above the parapet and post something a little different. Sadly that's the way of CL these days.

So, no offense, but if you respond, I'll expect you to prove that you're really a girl by attaching some fresh photos that are real, not ripped from someone else's FB profile or whatever! Or, you can record a voice message for me and attach it to your message. Whatever you like.

If you'd like to make my heart leap happily, use the subject line "It sounds like you might be describing me."

Cheers!

title: Casual...or not 😉
text:
I figured the best way to explain what it is I'm looking for, and why, would be to tell you about an experience that I had back in high school. And hey, it's Valentine's Day, so why not enjoy a little story? I'm a writer, so if you aren't a reader, feel free to skip my story (or this ad entirely). 
I'd like to tell you about Nicole from Colorado, the one that got away. 
I grew up going to church, always helping out, always going to camp. This is not to say I was ever one to abandon logic or reason, in fact, I'd always wanted to grow up to be a scientist, studying and discovering the way this world works. (Which I did, I received my degree in physics from UC Irvine and went on to work in solar energy.) When I was 16, I attended church camp, like I did every year, but this year we were joined by a young lady named Nicole. Strangely, she was placed in our cabin, I say this is strange because they keep boys and girls separated by cabin, and our cabins were on opposite ends of the camp (no hanky-panky). Our counsellor was quick to point out that "he" was with "his" gender identity, and that we were all expected to treat "him" like "just another one of the guys." I found this hard to believe; could this really be a boy? I found it nearly impossible to see the adorable, petite girl sitting in front of me as anything other than that. When I mentioned that God wants us to love each other, he merely answered that what we were doing was love and that if you love your brother, you will help him when he needs it, whether he asks for the help or not. So, I decided that I would get to know "him." I quickly found that he seemed like a woman. Not just in appearance (although he didn't look like a guy in the SLIGHTEST, in fact, I felt that he was easily the most attractive girl there), but inside, the way he acted, the way he talked, everything, a girl in every way. I simply COULD NOT see "him" as a guy. I prayed about this, and I came to the realization, this was more than ignorance, this stemmed from our arrogance, thinking we had both the god-given ability to decipher another person's gender, and the god-given right to then assign that gender to them. It's absurd to think that anyone other than you can decide your own gender; I can obtain limitless quantities of data on your behaviors and traits and STILL, you will know better. So, if someone says "I am female," then that is that!
Nicole and I hung out together everyday, and we got to know each other very well. 
One evening, we had a speaker come in and talk to the whole camp as a group. He began to explain how the world is out to get Christianity (like, in the negative sense). And that being Christians would make each of us targets in this world, but we have to stay strong. We have to fight against "scientists" who claim that our great, great grandparents were monkeys. I snorted, the kind of snort that you make when you are trying to hold in laughter but can't. We have to fight against homosexuals and their hidden agenda to turn everyone gay. That's when I began snorting uncontrollably. He stopped, looked up at me, and said, "you think this is funny, boy? You think this is some kinda joke?! It's taking place all over the world, right under our noses. Even in this very room. They confuse men into craving sex with other men. Sometimes even dressing up as women to lure good men into a trap. After awhile, some of them forget who they are and they actually start to think that they ARE women! Yeah, believe it. Right here in this very room..." He looked Nicole right in the eyes. I noticed she had started to cry. He said, "you still think this is funny?! Huh, you still think this is a joke?!"
I said, "no sir, you're the only joke in this room." I walked out and grabbed Nicole's hand as I did, pulling her to her feet and out the door. We took off into the woods together, and could hear the counsellors calling for us as we did. When we felt we had lost our pursuers, we sat on a large boulder at the base of a small hill. 
She began to explain to me that she didn't want to come to camp, but that her parents had made her, as they said she was "fallen from God's grace." 
She wiped the tear off my cheek as she was telling me all of this, and said "you don't need to feel sad for me. I've spent a lot of time thinking about this, and I'm NOT confused. I never even WAS confused until THEY began insisting that I was. I know who I am. . . And YOU remind me. And that certainty makes me happy and empowers me to take action in life and actually live, no longer second guessing every decision that I make." I placed my hand on hers and she rested her head on my shoulder. We sat there for a little while, just enjoying each other's company. My heart was fluttering like crazy. I knew who she was. She was a beautiful girl with a great sense of humor and a wonderful heart...and I liked her. We walked back to our cabin holding hands and she said, "I'm glad my parents made me come to camp."
When we finally made it back to our cabin, we found that all of the counsellors from our church were waiting for us, as well as the "camp leaders." They immediately separated us, sitting her in a bunk while taking me outside. 
They explained to me that I was headed down a dark path. That I was supposed to be friends with "him" to help "him" see all of these mistakes "he" was making. I asked, "how do you know that YOU aren't the ones who are mistaken?" They explained that God tells them what is right. I said, "well, unless he's actually called you on the phone, I don't see why you are so sure, because I feel like God told me that SHE is a girl! So, therefore, one of our gods is wrong."
This is when they asked, "do you LIKE him or something? In a romantic way? Are you actually feeling attracted to him?!" 
So, angry as I was at this point, I yelled "YES!!! And SO what?! I think SHE is the most beautiful GIRL at this god forsaken camp, and I have a huge crush on her!" 
They were quiet for what felt like hours. They finally said, "that would mean you like a boy, and you know what that means right? That would mean that you're gay."
"Or, because I'm straight, that would mean...she's a girl!"
"No, these are impure thoughts. This is exactly what Jacob (the speaker that night) was talking about. They make you think being gay is okay. Don't you see, she is just confusing you?" 
"She?" I asked. "You just said, 'she is confusing.' Not so easy for you to tell the difference after all, huh?" 
"That's enough! We are obviously going to have to separate you two." 
I followed them back into the cabin. I didn't know they were saying to her, but her cheeks were flushed and wet from tears, but I DO know that she heard what I said, because despite all of that, she was smiling at me. The kind of smile that you couldn't suppress if you wanted to. The kind of smile that will force its way to the surface despite all that is happening up there, despite all the turmoil, despite all the ugliness and unpleasantness. The purest smile.
They moved her out of my cabin that night. I figured they put her in a different cabin, as there were enough boys attending camp from our church that we had multiple cabins assigned to us. At breakfast, I was looking around for her, but couldn't find her anywhere. My counsellor leaned behind the kid sitting between us and whispered to me, "don't bother looking for him. The camp leaders called his parents and he was picked up late last night."
My heart sank.
I spent the rest of my time there in a fog. I couldn't enjoy anything. I missed Nicole.
By the time camp ended, she was back in Colorado.
I never saw her again. 
But, I'll never forget that smile.

So, why seek out someone who is transgendered? It's not like anything sexual occurred at that camp or that it is something I fetishize, but rather, after the experience that I had, I've found that I simply don't see a difference, and I feel like that makes me an ideal boyfriend. Ever since camp, I've been an active supporter of the LGBT community. And perhaps part of me is chasing down a romance that never really got a chance. Either way, I'm hoping that my story will illustrate where I'm coming from with this ad, and what it is I'm hoping to find. I am a successful and very attractive man, now 26 years old. I'd like to meet someone around my age (ideally younger), with a petite build, and an absolutely ADORABLE face. Also, although it may sound funny, I like a traditional kind of girl. A girl who is cute, a sweetheart, kinda reserved. A girl that I can take home to meet the parents. Anyway, please let me know what you think. Your pic gets mine. I'm 5'11", white, sky blue eyes, dark hair, a smile that'll melt your heart, and an athletic build. Despite the tone of my story, I'm actually a very funny guy. I tend to be the life of the party and can easily entertain guests for hours. So, you've got to have a sense of humor. Just hoping to find the girl for me.
If you think you could be that girl, that princess, please send me an email. You may browse here occasional, usually just observing what is out there. Perhaps you've never actually replied to an ad before. Perhaps you think that the type of guy you want couldn't possibly be on Craigslist. Well, I insist that you give me a shot. Most responses that I've received (after sending out my picture is), "wow, it's hard to believe that you would be on Craigslist." Well, I can promise you right now, any picture that you receive from me is real and accurate (although I will insist that you attach yours with your initial response). My point being, although I'm not sure who the "typical" Craigslist guy is, I can infer from the responses I've received that I am far from it.
Please respond with "summer love" as the subject, and include a clear, face picture. Thank you for taking the time to read my story. I hope you enjoyed it and are having a nice Valentine's Day.

title: Fun, Passionate Woman Desired (50 to 75) For Discreet Friendship
text:
I'm posting this ad in "Miscellaneous Romance" section because I'm not looking for just a casual encounter. I'm really seeking to connect with someone for a discreet long term relationship/friendship.

This may be a long shot, but I'm putting it out in the universe.

First of all, don't think that you're competing against a crowd of other women here, so don't hesitate to reply. I expect, at best, only a rarefied few to be in my age range and with a true interest and capacity in building such a relationship. And I promise that I will get back to you. The Internet can sometimes be a cold, isolating place. And I want to change that. 

Okay... now for full disclosure:
I'm 65 years old and married to a wonderful wife who, as all too many our age, is succumbing to old age. I thought passion would last forever. It didn't. I have gradually lost my passionate lover, hiking buddy, flea market companion, and all-around playmate. She still has her warmth, and her charm, so we are very close, and I am committed to enjoying life with her forever. 

I'm not looking to change my relationship status, nor yours. That said, I'm not old, not hardly, and, unlike my friends and acquaintances, I will not go gently into that good senior night. I've even checked out a local senior center, to hopefully meet and connect with a warm and passionate woman my age, only to feel that I am probably taking on an impossible quest.

Oddly, being fit and physically active, I am sometimes hit up on by women almost half my age. But I need an emotional connection that can only be met with a woman, who is also reasonably fit and active, and in my age range.

Your race is not important here. 

I am 5'11" tall, Caucasian, politically conservative, active, educated and handsome, and retired, with a fun, part time job. I live in the Oakland area and have grown children (out the house). I rarely drink, don't smoke, and I don't use recreational drugs (but I won't hold you to the same standards). And I am confident that you will not be disappointed.

I've received enough hate mail from this post, from those of you (who will probably never find intimacy anyway) who think that what I'm doing is wrong. Please keep your harsh and ugly comments to yourself. And stop brooding and resenting those of us who seek out excitement and romance in our lives.

Although we BabyBoomers like to believe otherwise, sobering clinical research bares out that women 60 years and older:
- 54% have lost all interest in sex. 
- 36% have a libido so low that it can scarcely be said to exist. 
I'm seeking out that rarefied 10%, who still burn with desire.

We do live in a parallel universe: 
One universe is the mainstream world that we've all familiar with since childhood, the open and highly visible society of order, civility, family and religion.

Welcome to the "other universe:" A time-honored hidden world in the shadows, where infidelity, lust and desire run their course, to fix and heal things that are not quite right in the first universe, and in a discreet and socially acceptable manner.

I can understand the many reasons why you may be hesitant to respond to my post:

Reason 1: I'm married (duh!).

Reason 2: You're married, or in a committed relationship, or simply "... curious and just browsing... " or you're being a bad girl and just might want to do something about it.

Reason 3: You think you're somehow unattractive and undesirable.

Reason 4: You have a deep, embarrassing, unspeakable handicap, a disease, or some sort of senior impairment, and somehow feel unworthy because of this.

Reason 5: You are reluctant to delve into that erotic underbelly of society (think CraigsList), where passions, needs and desires are satisfied.

Reason 6: You have the need for someone to be intimate with, but simply don't have the time, nor the interest for the demands of a full time relationship.

Reason 7: At your age you're now trying to get into Heaven, in earnest.


In answer to #1 and #2: "How come the best men are all married?!" a female co-worker exclaimed. And I've observed the same can sometimes apply to women.

#3 and #4: Do not feel that you are somehow unworthy. I've have always found women, my age and older, to be both interesting and attractive. Their strengths and shortcomings add depth to their personality and character. 

#5: Having butterflies in your stomach about all of this is completely normal, and part of the "rush" and exhilaration of the experience. It's your body telling you that your spirit is still alive inside you. But such ecstasy certainly won't happen if you don't take the plunge.

#6: This also sums up my situation. 

And as for reason #7: How long do you think you have left on this planet? 5 years... 10 years... err, uh... 15 years? Really? And do you honestly think that you'll retain your sharp mental faculties, and passions, to the very end?
I ask you to think about this: If the last 10 or 20 years are any indication, those remaining years will pass by rather quickly. And do you truly feel that there is no excitement and romance left in your life? When confronted with our ultimate destiny, some will virtuously react with fervent prayer. While others will choose to pop open the champagne and gleefully celebrate like there's no tomorrow.
Which one are you?

And how far am I willing to bend to find the right woman in this unlikely age group?

I have thought a great deal about this and am ready to make true compromises.

Hmmm... let me go ahead and say it all:

It's okay if you wear dentures, have wrinkles, gray or white hair (or bald), sagging breasts, small breasts, partial or full mastectomy, large thighs, partial or full hysterectomy, overweight (think Rubenesque), physical handicap, varicose veins, hemorrhoids, or an incurable disease, no college education, you for some reason consider yourself unattractive, wear senior clothes, or wear adult diapers (okay... I'll have to think a little more about these last two). 
All of these can be completely irrelevant, with the woman who radiates true warmth, passion and desire.

In your response to this ad, you do not have to provide a photo, nor your name, as there will be plenty of opportunity for personal exchanges after both of us feel that there is a connection. We must both discover a physical and emotional attraction. I want to be able to enjoy you, make you feel good.

Feel free to spell out any special needs and desires. This may the appropriate opportunity, while incognito, to tell me any of your deep, embarrassing, unspeakable handicaps, and get it off your chest. Really. You'll feel much better and relaxed after full disclosure. And I will get back to you, and very likely tell you that your very private concerns are okay.

After both of us develop an interest we can exchange photos and meet in a public place for coffee.

Daytime flexibility would be ideal for me, with occasional late evenings, and even some overnights. We can develop and nurture a rewarding relationship with our precious time: Express our affection for each other, exchange regular and intimate emails, with fun meetings at local coffee shops.

I promise that you will be rewarded with forbidden fruit: A fit and viral man, who will make you smile and warm your heart.

I am very active in the community. Having many projects and interests, I have a large Internet/international following, of which I can email you the fun and interesting links, after we meet. You are also invited to join me in any of my local group activities and causes, especially if you're looking to meet new people.

Even at my age I truly feel that life still has much in store for me. I'm looking for someone who wants to share in that excitement and adventure, someone I can communicate feelings and ideas with on a normal basis.

But I promise you that nothing at all will happen in your remaining years until you reach out and connect with someone.

title: older man seeks UCSC/Cabrillo undergrad
text:
Welcome. Thanks for opening my ad.

You are already weird in a nice way since you're looking at Craigslist ads (yes, people really did used to meet this way!) in a most retro fashion. I'd have expected you to be glued to Facebook, Tinder, Instagram, or some other smartphone app, and not to have much time for old-fashioned words typed on a screen.

But, apart from your willingness to meet someone via CL, or at least be entertained by the ads (hopefully you are not just doing a research project), just how weird are you?

Namely, did you notice the "51" that was also part of my ad? Yes, I am more than twice your age. I suspect you didn't notice that, so there's your warning not to read further.

Indeed, I want a friendship, and hopefully sexual relationship, with someone "scandalously" younger. What can I say: I love Nabokov; I love being a teacher as well as a student, I'd like to find a muse or a mentor as well as being one; I think power disparities (youth and beauty vs. "wisdom") are fascinating; I think a relationship that is a conspiracy a deux and that everyone else in the world disapproves of is hot.

The odds of finding this are minimal, I know. But, I've corresponded enough with those your age to know there are girls who share the dream. Especially, for some reason, at UCSC. (There's something about slugs -- ha!) 

One or two I came close to meeting, but for those particular individuals I failed the looks test (damn digital cameras!). I think I'm not bad-looking, and I have a nice smile; I'm tall (6' 2 1/2") and have blue eyes and shaggy brown hair. That said, you're dealing with a character actor, not a leading man, so to speak ...

I'm a writer, editor, and photographer, and most interested in hanging out with an artistic or musical girl. Scientists can be sexy too, and anyhow beggars like me can't be choosers, so just bring what you have.

I grew up almost friendless and being called queer throughout school. I didn't have any relationships at all until I was older than you are. Late bloomer. 

Now, I'm boringly hetero (though adventurous within that -- I don't like conventional sex roles and stereotypes) but certainly queer-friendly. I do have a bi woman friend who'd play with us both and is much closer to your age, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.

I madly love most types of music, though leaning more toward classical, trad jazz, some classic rock, lots of woman singer-songwriters, Sinatra and the rat pack. 

I like good beer and cocktails, plus single-malt whiskies, though at the moment I'm enduring a low carb diet (sigh). Good weed is an occasional pleasure, though a lot less than I used to. I'd also try molly -- or whatever they're calling it these days -- again if I knew it was legit. But, I'd rather enhance my life by looking at you and listening to your voice than via chemicals.

I'm not sure what to add, given that likely I'm whistling in the wind anyhow. But just in case I'm also whispering in your ear, well, I'll post this and perhaps refine it later.

I expect replies from the auto-spammers, as well as from the brigade of immature guys who like to pose as girls and fuck with people who dared to put their head up above the parapet and post something a little different. Sadly that's the way of CL these days.

So, no offense, but if you respond, I'll expect you to prove that you're really a girl by attaching some fresh photos that are real, not ripped from someone else's FB profile or whatever! Or, you can record a voice message for me and attach it to your message. Whatever you like.

If you'd like to make my heart leap happily, use the subject line "It sounds like you might be describing me."

Cheers!

title: My SF Fall Eve wth the Playwright
text:
What Tenn Thought of My Bedroom 

age: 68

On a foggy eve in the fall of '80, I caught a glimpse of Tennessee Wms. under-reaching for a bottle of gin off a shelf at a liquor store on Geary Blvd. Dressed in the habiliment of a 19th century Greek mariner (curly-hair wig and all), I was rapidly trotting to a disco on Polk St. Sans much consideration, I went to him, and handed him the bottle. "No need to thank the kindness of this stranger", or something else of that corny ilk I uttered to him. He was taken aback timidly by my "high" countenance & out-of-place costume. We sallied while he shopped and paid for snacks. I asked if I could walk with him to his destination, Colony Hotel. Upon reaching the foyer, he asked if I would visit with him. Lying to him, I stated that I was on my way home to feed "Mugger", my golden retriever.

When Ten Ten and I entered my cottage, I showed him to a seetee and later handed him a highball glass with ice. He inquired where the spiral staircase led to; I responded, "to the ballroom." "Ballroom? May I see it?" I toured him into my inordinately decorated bedroom, alight with five honey-wax candles in glass and wooden lanterns that cast arabesque silhouettes against the carroty bamboo ceiling. The ersatz tapestries (thumb-nailed quilts) quivered in the cross-breezes as we heard Muddy Waters jazz emanating from a neighboring cafe. He raised his eyes to look upon an embalmed Sicilian owl and Caucasian mouse perching on a rosemary branch above my German-made bed. Tenn was further roused by the scent of blooming orchids I cultivated on a portable fountain on the deck overlooking the steeples of twin churches.

He seemed nostalgically transported; closing his eyes and dilating his nares, he came closer to me and said he felt akin to being in the presence of the Moon Lake Casino. He asked to lie serenely next to me and experience pillow talk between us.

No longer am I this quixotic lad, neither are you a gallant poet. Nevertheless, I pine to be visited by a very mature "man of letters"; a gent steeped in sublime sensuousness with whom I can explore The Arts, intimate conversation, and perhaps physical expression. Tennessee gave me hours of delight. The other side of joy is that it is too frequently followed by crawling periods of grief over what is lost.

title: My SF Fall Eve wth the Playwright
text:
What Tenn Thought of My Bedroom 

age: 68

On a foggy eve in the fall of '80, I caught a glimpse of Tennessee Wms. under-reaching for a bottle of gin off a shelf at a liquor store on Geary Blvd. Dressed in the habiliment of a 19th century Greek mariner (curly-hair wig and all), I was rapidly trotting to a disco on Polk St. Sans much consideration, I went to him, and handed him the bottle. "No need to thank the kindness of this stranger", or something else of that corny ilk I uttered to him. He was taken aback timidly by my "high" countenance & out-of-place costume. We sallied while he shopped and paid for snacks. I asked if I could walk with him to his destination, Colony Hotel. Upon reaching the foyer, he asked if I would visit with him. Lying to him, I stated that I was on my way home to feed "Mugger", my golden retriever.

When Ten Ten and I entered my cottage, I showed him to a seetee and later handed him a highball glass with ice. He inquired where the spiral staircase led to; I responded, "to the ballroom." "Ballroom? May I see it?" I toured him into my inordinately decorated bedroom, alight with five honey-wax candles in glass and wooden lanterns that cast arabesque silhouettes against the carroty bamboo ceiling. The ersatz tapestries (thumb-nailed quilts) quivered in the cross-breezes as we heard Muddy Waters jazz emanating from a neighboring cafe. He raised his eyes to look upon an embalmed Sicilian owl and Caucasian mouse perching on a rosemary branch above my German-made bed. Tenn was further roused by the scent of blooming orchids I cultivated on a portable fountain on the deck overlooking the steeples of twin churches.

He seemed nostalgically transported; closing his eyes and dilating his nares, he came closer to me and said he felt akin to being in the presence of the Moon Lake Casino. He asked to lie serenely next to me and experience pillow talk between us.

No longer am I this quixotic lad, neither are you a gallant poet. Nevertheless, I pine to be visited by a very mature "man of letters"; a gent steeped in sublime sensuousness with whom I can explore The Arts, intimate conversation, and perhaps physical expression. Tennessee gave me hours of delight. The other side of joy is that it is too frequently followed by crawling periods of grief over what is lost.

title: older man seeks UCSC/Cabrillo undergrad
text:
Welcome. Thanks for opening my ad.

You are already weird in a nice way since you're looking at Craigslist ads (yes, people really did used to meet this way!) in a most retro fashion. I'd have expected you to be glued to Facebook, Tinder, Instagram, or some other smartphone app, and not to have much time for old-fashioned words typed on a screen.

But, apart from your willingness to meet someone via CL, or at least be entertained by the ads (hopefully you are not just doing a research project), just how weird are you?

Namely, did you notice the "51" that was also part of my ad? Yes, I am more than twice your age. I suspect you didn't notice that, so there's your warning not to read further.

Indeed, I want a friendship, and hopefully sexual relationship, with someone "scandalously" younger. What can I say: I love Nabokov; I love being a teacher as well as a student, I'd like to find a muse or a mentor as well as being one; I think power disparities (youth and beauty vs. "wisdom") are fascinating; I think a relationship that is a conspiracy a deux and that everyone else in the world disapproves of is hot.

The odds of finding this are minimal, I know. But, I've corresponded enough with those your age to know there are girls who share the dream. Especially, for some reason, at UCSC. (There's something about slugs -- ha!) 

One or two I came close to meeting, but for those particular individuals I failed the looks test (damn digital cameras!). I think I'm not bad-looking, and I have a nice smile; I'm tall (6' 2 1/2") and have blue eyes and shaggy brown hair. That said, you're dealing with a character actor, not a leading man, so to speak ...

I'm a writer, editor, and photographer, and most interested in hanging out with an artistic or musical girl. Scientists can be sexy too, and anyhow beggars like me can't be choosers, so just bring what you have.

I grew up almost friendless and being called queer throughout school. I didn't have any relationships at all until I was older than you are. Late bloomer. 

Now, I'm boringly hetero (though adventurous within that -- I don't like conventional sex roles and stereotypes) but certainly queer-friendly. I do have a bi woman friend who'd play with us both and is much closer to your age, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.

I madly love most types of music, though leaning more toward classical, trad jazz, some classic rock, lots of woman singer-songwriters, Sinatra and the rat pack. 

I like good beer and cocktails, plus single-malt whiskies, though at the moment I'm enduring a low carb diet (sigh). Good weed is an occasional pleasure, though a lot less than I used to. I'd also try molly -- or whatever they're calling it these days -- again if I knew it was legit. But, I'd rather enhance my life by looking at you and listening to your voice than via chemicals.

I'm not sure what to add, given that likely I'm whistling in the wind anyhow. But just in case I'm also whispering in your ear, well, I'll post this and perhaps refine it later.

I expect replies from the auto-spammers, as well as from the brigade of immature guys who like to pose as girls and fuck with people who dared to put their head up above the parapet and post something a little different. Sadly that's the way of CL these days.

So, no offense, but if you respond, I'll expect you to prove that you're really a girl by attaching some fresh photos that are real, not ripped from someone else's FB profile or whatever! Or, you can record a voice message for me and attach it to your message. Whatever you like.

If you'd like to make my heart leap happily, use the subject line "It sounds like you might be describing me."

Cheers!

title: Seeking curvy smart sf nonconformist for ???
text:
Hi. Buckle in for the epic journey! I should start by saying that I am in an open relationship. Don't want anyone to do all this reading if that isn't ok. My facial hair fluctuates, but I am very open to my partner's preferences. If you are outside SF/Daly city/Pacifica, probably won't work. I live near the beach and east bay by bart is 90 minutes or longer each way and driving is an hour or more each way. I just can't see being able to make that a sustainable relationship. So think 30-45 minutes from ocean beach. If you feel like you are my fate destined soul mate and live further, say hi. Otherwise, probably will lead to frustration and heartbreak. So why start that, right? I am open to whatever life throws my way. That is definitely true for relationships. I am open to a variety of types of relationships. Life is too short to have firm expectations. I feel I would most want a long term other primary partner or really close secondary partner. FWB where friends is legit could work as well. Nothing too casual. Not seeking a harem! Eeeew.

About me. I am 44. I don't feel or look (so I have been told) that age. Whatever that means. I am an extremely honest and ethical person with a strong sense of honor. I have a dark and wicked sense of humor which never translates in these profiles. Somehow they always end up reading really dry and serious. I tend to lean towards anarchist politics, though I don't feel the need to debate folks. Meh. Oh well. I am something of the reformed bad boy type. I still am a little edgy, while being safe and sane and all grown up.

I was born and raised in SF, but have lived all over the country. I have done a ton of different jobs over the years and have lived a very full life. 

I have two sons. They are seven and ten years old and have autism. They are beautiful and amazing kids! I generally don't like to have anyone I am dating meet them until it is clearly getting serious. I also don't need my partner to be around them if kids aren't their thing. I am cool either way. We live in my mom's house. NO, I am not a bum or loser! My mom has health issues and I help her. My grandmother lives next door and is ninety and needs my help as well. I am able to do those things and live with my kids in the big ass house I grew up in, in a quiet neighborhood. It is definitely a blessing. But some haters gotta hate, so there you go. I have in house baby sitting, hence the time for a relationship.

I currently work in a before/after school program in SF. I taught for nearly ten years in a SF high school, but had to move for a family emergency. Things have settled down to the point that I am starting to look for a full time teaching gig again. Maybe. I spend a lot of time volunteering in my kids school as well.

I am a lifelong punk. That being said, my taste in music goes all over the map and includes just about anything that isn't mindless bubblegum. I don't drink, smoke or do any drugs. I used to. I smoked for ten plus years and quit about twenty years ago. I don't mind being with a smoker as long as I don't have to breathe it. I have never been much of a drinker. Just don't enjoy it. I don't mind being with someone who drinks. Just not to the point of me having to bail you out or having to clean up puke. I was married to an alcoholic and will never live with that again. I was a total pothead for a long time. I quit years ago to be more present and a better dad for my kids. I don't mind pot smoking at all. Smoke 'em if you got 'em! In my teens and twenties I did a lot of psychedelics. Haven't done any in 20 years, but don't mind if partner does them once in a while.

As far as who I find attractive, it is pretty wide open. I am attracted to people who are comfortable in themselves. I am definitely partial to tattoos and current/ex punk, metal or goth gals. By no means a requirement though. I am super open to age as well. I seek someone who is wise and mature. The numbers don't mean shit. I am attracted to class and character, brains and honor and integrity, not bodies.

I am heavily tattooed. I have sleeves on both arms. I have large pieces on both legs and some on my chest and back.

I am a very gentle, giving, loving and sweet person. I am super affectionate. In a good way. Been told that I am a good kisser and give the best hugs. Also been told that my massages are top notch. I am a very present and attentive partner and a fantastic listener. I am a very good communicator. I am still friendly with just about all my ex's. I am a keeper. Someone will be very lucky to have me. :)

I tend to not be a fan of consumerism, pop culture or technology. Not that I need someone in my life to be against those things, but definitely not driven by them either. I get the most pleasure in life spending quiet time with special people in beautiful, natural places. Building joy filled, deeply connected and present relationships is what I find most rewarding. Hiking and camping and day trips are my favorite things. I am definitely big on social justice and living an ethical life, but don't like to preach or argue with people. I am very open minded and always glad to hear different views. I go to a Buddhist meditation group a few times a week. If that appeals to you, come along. If not, don't. I don't talk a lot about it or try to tell people they should. I am respectful of different views and takes on that sort of thing. I am very well read and love to talk about all sorts of interesting, random and weird things.

I intentionally work part time to be able to better care for my kids. That means that we live simply. If you require a partner that has money for fancy things I am not him. I am really only good for a similarly simplicity focused and contented person. I am absolutely not cheap. I am extremely generous of spirit and energy and love, but live on a budget. I know that will lead many readers to click away. Best wishes to you. To those who shrug their shoulders and think "I am cool with that" or "that is how I live as well" by all means read on!!!

I manage to have about two or three days a week for a relationship by having a family friend who is something of a live in nanny or second dad who watches my boys and allows me to have "me" time and keep my sanity. :) Also, if you are cool with hanging out with the fam, I can have more time available. I sound super busy, and I am. I also am lucky to be able to make significant time available for a relationship. I am blessed in that way.

Things I enjoy:
Books: Invisible Man, Fight Club, Huck Finn, Siddhartha, Shawshank Redemption, 1984, Brave New World, Dark Tower, just about anything Clive Barker, Malcolm X, The Stand, The Talisman...shit, I am an English teacher. This could go on forever. Rushdie, Joyce, Vonnegut, Bradbury, Mahfouz, Rumi, Hemingway....Comic books! Pema Chodron, Jack Kornfield, Noah Levine, Stephen Levine, Ram Dass.

Movies: Fight Club, Shawshank Redemption, Wonder Boys, Watchmen, Memento, Usual Suspects, Pulp Fiction, Matrix, Gilbert Grape, The Road...and so on.

TV: Deadwood, Walking Dead, Penny Dreadful, Ray Donovan, Breaking Bad, Carnivale, Dexter, The Wire, Sopranos, South Park, Boondocks, American Dad.....

Music: Way too much to list. My faves are Punk, Metal, Classic Rock, Jazz, Old Country, Rap, Opera.

Food: Indian, Ethiopian, Middle Eastern, Creole, Cajun, Taqueria and of course pizza.

Say hello if you are compelled to and think we are a good match. Cheers!

title: I would like to know your mind
text:
*Please read me slowly* 

I have realized that not much long lasting can happen between two people unless they have similar minds, unless they share a similar outlook on life. And of course there is more to life and sharing life than only the physical or sexual part, so by having similar minds two will have another way of relating to one another and be able to share something deeper than only the physical or sexual. So I am looking to know your mind. 

I think that a true and deep connection between two people is a very important part of life. So I am looking for one man who has found within himself a certainty that he also wants that one other person to share life with. To me this means two considering each other together as a team. Life is trying, and it seems to me that having some one on one's side, and likewise being on his side, is something to be greatly desired and prized. 

Such things cannot be forced, I know. I am not writing because I desperately want to force something with someone. Perhaps a little finesse around the edges may be needed here and there, but force: no. Here in this note to you I am limited to only reaching out with words, so I hope that these words will draw you in and encourage a response in kind. 

It seems to me that there is a kind of secret quest to life. Life really is rather ordinary, and many of us fill the time running from boredom. But at the end of the day, what have we found? Often it is the same cold and empty bed that we had the night before. That's okay, so long as we don't someday find that our heart too is cold and empty. I think that part of the secret quest of life is to remember to share the warmth of one's heart with one other. 

So where is the man who wants to have a deep connection and team-up with another man so that we can share together such a secret of the heart's warmth? Maybe I press the poet too hard when I write this sort of thing, but I also think that this thought is in another's mind too: that is the man who I wish to find. He who can think on the level of the soul; he who can enjoy the happy simple times of life, full of the absence of excessive worry and anxiety. Yes, Pax has the keys and he will show us in if we will. 

Often excitement needs to be sacrificed to have joy. And I am willing to quest for joy, as I find much pleasure and fulfillment in a simple life. If this describes you too, then we may be a good match; if you like crowds or sports, then I don't think that we would be a good match. Please like books. 

If you write, please share with me your age, location, and ethnicity. I am looking for one man who is 35 to 40 years old (real age, please). I also like a man who is average shape to a few extra pounds, and who has an average sized to a bit smaller cut cock.

I am a lifelong punk. That being said, my taste in music goes all over the map and includes just about anything that isn't mindless bubblegum. I don't drink, smoke or do any drugs. I used to. I smoked for ten plus years and quit about twenty years ago. I don't mind being with a smoker as long as I don't have to breathe it. I have never been much of a drinker. Just don't enjoy it. I don't mind being with someone who drinks. Just not to the point of me having to bail you out or having to clean up puke. I was married to an alcoholic and will never live with that again. I was a total pothead for a long time. I quit years ago to be more present and a better dad for my kids. I don't mind pot smoking at all. Smoke 'em if you got 'em! In my teens and twenties I did a lot of psychedelics. Haven't done any in 20 years, but don't mind if partner does them once in a while.

As far as who I find attractive, it is pretty wide open. I am attracted to people who are comfortable in themselves. I am definitely partial to tattoos and current/ex punk, metal or goth gals. By no means a requirement though. I am super open to age as well. I seek someone who is wise and mature. The numbers don't mean shit. I am attracted to class and character, brains and honor and integrity, not bodies.

I am heavily tattooed. I have sleeves on both arms. I have large pieces on both legs and some on my chest and back.

I am a very gentle, giving, loving and sweet person. I am super affectionate. In a good way. Been told that I am a good kisser and give the best hugs. Also been told that my massages are top notch. I am a very present and attentive partner and a fantastic listener. I am a very good communicator. I am still friendly with just about all my ex's. I am a keeper. Someone will be very lucky to have me. :)

I tend to not be a fan of consumerism, pop culture or technology. Not that I need someone in my life to be against those things, but definitely not driven by them either. I get the most pleasure in life spending quiet time with special people in beautiful, natural places. Building joy filled, deeply connected and present relationships is what I find most rewarding. Hiking and camping and day trips are my favorite things. I am definitely big on social justice and living an ethical life, but don't like to preach or argue with people. I am very open minded and always glad to hear different views. I go to a Buddhist meditation group a few times a week. If that appeals to you, come along. If not, don't. I don't talk a lot about it or try to tell people they should. I am respectful of different views and takes on that sort of thing. I am very well read and love to talk about all sorts of interesting, random and weird things.

I intentionally work part time to be able to better care for my kids. That means that we live simply. If you require a partner that has money for fancy things I am not him. I am really only good for a similarly simplicity focused and contented person. I am absolutely not cheap. I am extremely generous of spirit and energy and love, but live on a budget. I know that will lead many readers to click away. Best wishes to you. To those who shrug their shoulders and think "I am cool with that" or "that is how I live as well" by all means read on!!!

I manage to have about two or three days a week for a relationship by having a family friend who is something of a live in nanny or second dad who watches my boys and allows me to have "me" time and keep my sanity. :) Also, if you are cool with hanging out with the fam, I can have more time available. This could go on forever. Rushdie, Joyce, Vonnegut, Bradbury, Mahfouz, Rumi, Hemingway....Comic books! Pema Chodron, Jack Kornfield, Noah Levine, Stephen Levine, Ram Dass.

Movies: Fight Club, Shawshank Redemption, Wonder Boys, Watchmen, Memento, Usual Suspects, Pulp Fiction, Matrix, Gilbert Grape, The Road...and so on.

TV: Deadwood, Walking Dead, Penny Dreadful, Ray Donovan, Breaking Bad, Carnivale, Dexter, The Wire, Sopranos, South Park, Boondocks, American Dad.....

Music: Way too much to list. My faves are Punk, Metal, Classic Rock, Jazz, Old Country, Rap, Opera.

Food: Indian, Ethiopian, Middle Eastern, Creole, Cajun, Taqueria and of course pizza.

Say hello if you are compelled to and think we are a good match. Cheers!

title: Seeking LTR TS Relationship for my Husband
text:
I realize this is unconventional, placing an ad for my husband but I want to talk to prospective dates before he does. Recently he was dating someone who he really intimately connected with and was excited about and then she turned out to be hung up on her ex. This has really hurt him and I feel very protective and want to make sure that the people who are interested in meeting him are actually indeed available. Obviously, we all assume risk in the dating world but I want to minimize this if I can by talking to some interested parties first and possibly answer any questions you may have. Also, I find that people tend to not believe that it is ok with me that my husband places a personal ad and that we aren't really in an open marriage. I assure you we are and I am ok with him having another committed intimate relationship. 

I came out to him as Asexual last year after being married over 15 years and then a few years of being not physical but still romantic and loving with each other. I realized then that I had always been Asexual but I never knew what the term even meant. While it allowed me to gain some truth and clarity about myself, it caused a disconnect as my husband hadn't changed. He was still a sexual person! I still loved and felt romantic feelings toward him, but I knew that I could never be physical with him as he deserved someone who was into it 110%. I want him to be happy and was ready to let him go if that is what he needed to be fulfilled. I wanted him to be free to be able to find someone who could give him everything he deserves and wants. He has been determined to make our lives together work, even if this requires having a 3rd person in the equation. He is not a casual sex kind of guy, he needs an intimate connection to be happy. He has always been a supportive and loving partner and I want him to have the life he has always dreamed of. He deserves it because he is amazing! He is one of the most honest, well-spoken, creative and truly talented people I have ever met. He is also a genuinely funny, charismatic, sweet and incredibly caring person. I think with both of us, it is really important to let people be in a comfortable environment that supports one being who they truly are. Whether that is who they are now at this moment or who they would like to become at some point. To have the freedom to be and become who you are and want to be is a gift. I believe we both feel really strongly about being in an environment that is supportive of this. For each other, friends, anyone we care about.

It is not a typical situation and open marriages and Asexuality aren't something everyone understands (or even accepts) but it doesn't mean that I am emotionally unavailable or that my husband is just looking for sex, or that he is "experimenting" or that he is "looking to find himself" or any of the other condescending and insulting assumptions that we are often confronted with by folks who judge others by Judeo/Christian societal norms. Also his attraction to transsexuals doesn't mean he is a "chaser" or a "fetishist". It means he is drawn to femininity and if he is attracted to someone who is feminine enough and he actually likes you as a person and you like him, if you end up having sex together he will work with whatever you've got...conversely he is not attracted to the male form so while a FTM transsexual may have a vagina, simply having a vagina isn't enough to generate an attraction for him. He also enjoys the company and connection with other unconventional people who yearn to simply be accepted by the world around them for the unique people they are. He is quite aware of who he is and what moves him. He is not prone to "kidding" himself.

About him: He is a white heterosexual male living here in Oakland and he works in SF. He is 47 years old, 5'11", 190, fit, HIV-, non-smoking, non-drug user, light social drinker, clean...He is a musician writer, audio/video producer. He is very respectful and understanding. He is easy going, friendly, smart, engaged, creative and he truly enjoys the company of someone with similar qualities.

He is available for overnight stays, dates, weekend getaways, travel, etc. We also own a large home with a large, comfortable guest room that he can have company over in. We are completely above board and honest...I would be fine with meeting his potential partner if it made them more comfortable with the arrangement. The person he meets would be welcome in our home to hang out and visit, stay over or even live here if a real, committed, long term relationship develops as we have a large home with extra rooms and no children. This is not an invitation for a 3-way relationship as I am an Asexual and he has no interest in group-sex. A friendship with me is not out of the question if there is a natural mutual interest in pursuing one.

What he is looking for, ideally, is an ongoing romantic relationship with a TS who lives her life as a woman fulltime who isn't jealous and understands that they're more than just "the other woman" or a "piece on the side" but rather they are involved with someone who is capable of sharing his heart with her and being present while they're in each other's presence and away. He is not looking to play the field and he is not looking to just screw everyone he meets. He is looking for one person to share this part of his life with for as long as you are both happy doing so. 

Physically/sexually he is a total top guy if it comes to that. As for physical/social characteristics, he is pretty accepting so race isn't a factor for him and finds a variety of body types attractive...it really comes down to the individual and their comfort in their own skin. He also tends to be more physically comfortable with someone 5'10" or shorter but neither of these things are close to being deal breakers as personality, intelligence and individual charisma are way more important. He likes educated, classy individuals who aren't overly judgmental and don't believe their good fortune gives them the right to treat others like crap or look down on them. He is not interested in superficiality, reality television, or intellectual fast food, distractions and other nonsense. He enjoys fun spirited exchanges, meditation, and just plain old destination free arm in arm walks with someone he cares about. Just sitting around being with one another is great too.

Hopefully I have explained the situation and my guy well enough for you to get a picture of what life is like with us. We have an open chair at our table and are hoping to make someone a permanent dinner guest. If you have any further questions, please ask. We try to be open and honest about our lives and ideally what we want out of it.
If you would like to meet him send me an email and let me know what you are looking for. A clear face pic or two would be helpful too. Looking forward to talking to you.

title: Walking in the rain
text:
This life just doesn't seem to be worth it.
The love I feel for those I love the most, doesn't matter; it's never enough.
I am a shitty father cause I love too much.
I am a shitty friend cause I'm never there.
I am a shitty lover cause I can't react the right way to things I can't control.
I am a shitty son cause I'm too busy trying to live my life; take care of everyone & everything in it. 
This life has taught me to strive for patience and understanding.
But the patience and understanding has constantly resulted in too much compromise. Giving in to the point that I don't even know who I am, what to think, what to believe. 
These acts of patience and understanding teach me to give in. Forget myself. Others are more important. Compromise. Let people take, take, take. 
Take my love.
Take my money.
Take my joy.
Take my sanity.
Take my manhood.

My dreams are gone.
My hopes have disappeared.
My spark is extinguished. 
Life is pointless. 

I love my girlfriend. 
I love her children.
I love my children.
I love our relationship.
But at what cost?
To forget myself, my beliefs, my feelings, to feel alone? 
To serve, to compromise, to change?
For what?
Why continue to try? 
To feel, to love?
The end feels so warm, so relaxed, so welcoming. 
The dark cloud above continues to grow. The cold overcomes me.
Why continue in the darkness and cold when the warmth feels so welcoming?

I give and give and give.
When the limit is reached, I speak up, ask for help, for understanding. 
I'm told I'm a jerk, an asshole.
Why is everyone around me allowed to voice their opinions, their thoughts, their beliefs, their feelings, but I cannot?
I'm to be understanding and forgiving? 
Why cant my feelings be validated?
What's the point?
Why is this so hard to comprehend?
I see others accepted for who they truly are. 
Why am I so different?

Life is 10% of what happens to me and 90% how I react to it. I get it, I do.
But why, when I exercise patience, is it misunderstood?
Why is my kindness taken for weakness?
Why am I not heard?
Is it because I'm scared?
Scared from the past and how the family I've loved the most were pushed away when I expressed my feelings?

I hear your heart; it speaks to me of love, compassion, understanding.
I hear your mind; it speaks of what you want in life, what you've been through.
I see the red flags go up in your mind. I desperately want to rip them down.
At times our life is busy with responsibilities.
So busy that they consume my mind, my time. Because of this, it causes conflict with you and I.
It shows you I don't care, don't listen, don't love.
I love you with everything I have sweetheart. 

I've tried explaining this.
My mother doesn't know.
My friends don't know. 
You don't know.
I've tried getting help. 
Tried to drink away the sorrows, the pain. 
It's forever there.

I'm standing at the edge, ready to jump.
I see your face.
I see the faces of the kids, my grandfather. 
Will you take my hand? Will you pull me back?

title: Why is Romance Miscellaneous?
text:

I'm a middle aged white male, considered handsome by some, reasonably fit and in good health. At this point in my life, I'm pointing my gaze inward and asking myself not what I want from a relationship, but what I can offer. I can provide stability, consistency and a nurturing disposition. I own my own home, have a good job, a few good friends, and am close to my family. I can provide a warm fuzzy chest to lay your head or a pair of strong hands to massage those kinks out of your shoulders. I can provide compassion during the hard times and lot of laughter during the good.

This is not to say that I don't have my own needs and desires, but we can discuss those in person. I will say this, however. The one quality that is essential for you to possess is stability -- that you are grounded in all parts of your life. While I'm not looking for a lot of disruption, I am able to compromise and provide the time and energy that is takes to develop a successful relationship.

I'm not perfect and still have much growing to do. But I'd rather focus on that exploration in the company of another.

If you'd care for a brief description, I'm 51, white, openly gay, masculine, hairy, couple of tattoos, goatee, buzzed head. I'm 5'8", 185#. I have three cats and two aquariums. I enjoy swimming and biking, reading, gardening, movies and music, road trips, geography, astronomy and photography. I'm an educated professional, good communicator, very passionate and sexually versatile. I'm also HIV negative and STD free.

title: My SF Fall Eve wth the Playwright
text:
What Tenn Thought of My Bedroom 

age: 68

On a foggy eve in the fall of '80, I caught a glimpse of Tennessee Wms. under-reaching for a bottle of gin off a shelf at a liquor store on Geary Blvd. Dressed in the habiliment of a 19th century Greek mariner (curly-hair wig and all), I was rapidly trotting to a disco on Polk St. Sans much consideration, I went to him, and handed him the bottle. "No need to thank the kindness of this stranger", or something else of that corny ilk I uttered to him. He was taken aback timidly by my "high" countenance & out-of-place costume. We sallied while he shopped and paid for snacks. I asked if I could walk with him to his destination, Colony Hotel. Upon reaching the foyer, he asked if I would visit with him. Lying to him, I stated that I was on my way home to feed "Mugger", my golden retriever.

When Ten Ten and I entered my cottage, I showed him to a seetee and later handed him a highball glass with ice. He inquired where the spiral staircase led to; I responded, "to the ballroom." "Ballroom? May I see it?" I toured him into my inordinately decorated bedroom, alight with five honey-wax candles in glass and wooden lanterns that cast arabesque silhouettes against the carroty bamboo ceiling. The ersatz tapestries (thumb-nailed quilts) quivered in the cross-breezes as we heard Muddy Waters jazz emanating from a neighboring cafe. He raised his eyes to look upon an embalmed Sicilian owl and Caucasian mouse perching on a rosemary branch above my German-made bed. Tenn was further roused by the scent of blooming orchids I cultivated on a portable fountain on the deck overlooking the steeples of twin churches.

He seemed nostalgically transported; closing his eyes and dilating his nares, he came closer to me and said he felt akin to being in the presence of the Moon Lake Casino. He asked to lie serenely next to me and experience pillow talk between us.

No longer am I this quixotic lad, neither are you a gallant poet. Nevertheless, I pine to be visited by a very mature "man of letters"; a gent steeped in sublime sensuousness with whom I can explore The Arts, intimate conversation, and perhaps physical expression. Tennessee gave me hours of delight. The other side of joy is that it is too frequently followed by crawling periods of grief over what is lost.

title: Mature Woman Desired (50 to 75) For Discreet Friendship
text:
I'm not looking for just a casual encounter, nor a platonic one. I'm really seeking to connect with someone for a discreet long term relationship/friendship.

This may be a long shot, but I'm putting it out in the universe.

First of all, don't think that you're competing against a crowd of other women here, so don't hesitate to reply. I expect, at best, only a rarefied few to be in my age range and with a true interest and capacity in building such a relationship. And I promise that I will get back to you. The Internet can sometimes be a cold, isolating place. And I want to change that. 

Okay... now for full disclosure:
I'm 65 years old and married to a wonderful wife who, as all too many our age, is succumbing to old age. I thought passion would last forever. It didn't. I have gradually lost my passionate lover, hiking buddy, flea market companion, and all-around playmate. She still has her warmth, and her charm, so we are very close, and I am committed to enjoying life with her forever. 

I'm not looking to change my relationship status, nor yours. That said, I'm not old, not hardly, and, unlike my friends and acquaintances, I will not go gently into that good senior night. I've even checked out a local senior center, to hopefully meet and connect with a warm and passionate woman my age, only to feel that I am probably taking on an impossible quest.

Oddly, being fit and physically active, I am sometimes hit up on by women almost half my age. But I need an emotional connection that can only be met with a woman, who is also reasonably fit and active, and in my age range.

Your race is not important here. 

I am 5'11" tall, Caucasian, politically conservative, active, educated and handsome, and retired, with a fun, part time job. I live in the Oakland area and have grown children (out the house). I rarely drink, don't smoke, and I don't use recreational drugs (but I won't hold you to the same standards). And I am confident that you will not be disappointed.

I've received enough hate mail from this post, from those of you (who will probably never find intimacy anyway) who think that what I'm doing is wrong. Please keep your harsh and ugly comments to yourself. And stop brooding and resenting those of us who seek out excitement and romance in our lives.

Although we BabyBoomers like to believe otherwise, sobering clinical research bares out that women 60 years and older:
- 54% have lost all interest in sex. 
- 36% have a libido so low that it can scarcely be said to exist. 
I'm seeking out that rarefied 10%, who still burn with desire.

We do live in a parallel universe: 
One universe is the mainstream world that we've all familiar with since childhood, the open and highly visible society of order, civility, family and religion.

Welcome to the "other universe:" A time-honored hidden world in the shadows, where infidelity, lust and desire run their course, to fix and heal things that are not quite right in the first universe, and in a discreet and socially acceptable manner.

I can understand the many reasons why you may be hesitant to respond to my post:

Reason 1: I'm married (duh!).

Reason 2: You're married, or in a committed relationship, or simply "... curious and just browsing... " or you're being a bad girl and just might want to do something about it.

Reason 3: You think you're somehow unattractive and undesirable.

Reason 4: You have a deep, embarrassing, unspeakable handicap, a disease, or some sort of senior impairment, and somehow feel unworthy because of this.

Reason 5: You are reluctant to delve into that erotic underbelly of society (think CraigsList), where passions, needs and desires are satisfied.

Reason 6: You have the need for someone to be intimate with, but simply don't have the time, nor the interest for the demands of a full time relationship.

Reason 7: At your age you're now trying to get into Heaven, in earnest.


In answer to #1 and #2: "How come the best men are all married?!" a female co-worker exclaimed. And I've observed the same can sometimes apply to women.

#3 and #4: Do not feel that you are somehow unworthy. I've have always found women, my age and older, to be both interesting and attractive. Their strengths and shortcomings add depth to their personality and character. 

#5: Having butterflies in your stomach about all of this is completely normal, and part of the "rush" and exhilaration of the experience. It's your body telling you that your spirit is still alive inside you. But such ecstasy certainly won't happen if you don't take the plunge.

#6: This also sums up my situation. 

And as for reason #7: How long do you think you have left on this planet? 5 years... 10 years... err, uh... 15 years? Really? Believe me: Those online Life Expectancy Calculators are wildly optimistic, and intentionally misleading. And do you honestly think that you'll retain your sharp mental faculties, and passions, to the very end?
I ask you to think about this: If the last 10 or 20 years are any indication, those remaining years will pass by rather quickly. And do you truly feel that there is no excitement and romance left in your life? When confronted with our ultimate destiny, some will virtuously react with fervent prayer. While others will choose to pop open the champagne and gleefully celebrate like there's no tomorrow.
Which one are you?

And how far am I willing to bend to find the right woman in this unlikely age group?

I have thought a great deal about this and am ready to make true compromises.

Hmmm... let me go ahead and say it all:

It's okay if you wear dentures, have wrinkles, gray or white hair (or bald), sagging breasts, small breasts, partial or full mastectomy, large thighs, partial or full hysterectomy, overweight (think Rubenesque), physical handicap, double chin, varicose veins, hemorrhoids, or an incurable disease, no college education, you for some reason consider yourself unattractive, wear senior clothes, or wear adult diapers (okay... I'll have to think a little more about these last two). 
All of these can be completely irrelevant, with the woman who radiates true warmth, passion and desire.

In your response to this ad, you do not have to provide a photo, nor your name, as there will be plenty of opportunity for personal exchanges after both of us feel that there is a connection. We must both discover a physical and emotional attraction. I want to be able to enjoy you, make you feel good.

Feel free to spell out any special needs and desires. This may the appropriate opportunity, while incognito, to tell me any of your deep, embarrassing, unspeakable handicaps, and get it off your chest. Really. You'll feel much better and relaxed after full disclosure. And I will get back to you, and very likely tell you that your very private concerns are okay.

After both of us develop an interest we can exchange photos and meet in a public place for coffee.

Daytime flexibility would be ideal for me, with occasional late evenings, and even some overnights. We can develop and nurture a rewarding relationship with our precious time: Express our affection for each other, exchange regular and intimate emails, with fun meetings at local coffee shops.

I promise that you will be rewarded with forbidden fruit: A fit and viral man, who will make you smile and warm your heart.

I am very active in the community. Having many projects and interests, I have a large Internet/international following, of which I can email you the fun and interesting links, after we meet. You are also invited to join me in any of my local group activities and causes, especially if you're looking to meet new people.

Even at my age I truly feel that life still has much in store for me. I'm looking for someone who wants to share in that excitement and adventure, someone I can communicate feelings and ideas with on a normal basis.

But I promise you that nothing at all will happen in your remaining years until you reach out and connect with someone.

title: Monogamous Causal Relationship
text:
I've been doing the dating thing for a while now, and found that the best thing for me, at least at the moment, isn't a traditional relationship. I don't want to get married again (not at the moment, at least) and I don't want more kids (I have two that I love very much, and see every day), but I do miss having someone in my life that I can spend time with doing things that we both enjoy, but also still have time for myself. 

This is not a posting looking for just sex, though a healthy (and frequent!) sex life is very important to me, I also need to have other aspects of companionship to complement the sex. I don't want to call this a FWB thing, and while it does sound like that I want to have the option for more if that is where this is leading. So this is what I propose: I'm looking for a woman that wants to form a monogamous relationship with me, where we can meet a couple of times a week, enjoy each others company (both in and out of the bedroom), and have a great time without worrying about all the other details of couples.

And like I said, high sex drive! 

What I look for in a woman is some similar interests and outlook on life. I don't want a clone of me, differences make things interesting. Physically I don't really have a particular "type", I'm attracted to various types of women, though it seems the ones that I eventually date tend to be a bit on the curvy side. title: Why is Romance Miscellaneous?
text:
You get to learn quite a bit about people in the way in which they post their personals ads. Most of these ads tell you what the other person is looking for, but not what they have to offer. But isn't that REALLY what this format is about?

I'm a middle aged white male, considered handsome by some, reasonably fit and in good health. At this point in my life, I'm pointing my gaze inward and asking myself not what I want from a relationship, but what I can offer. I can provide stability, consistency and a nurturing disposition. I own my own home, have a good job, a few good friends, and am close to my family. I can provide a warm fuzzy chest to lay your head or a pair of strong hands to massage those kinks out of your shoulders. I can provide compassion during the hard times and lot of laughter during the good.

This is not to say that I don't have my own needs and desires, but we can discuss those in person. I will say this, however. The one quality that is essential for you to possess is stability -- that you are grounded in all parts of your life. While I'm not looking for a lot of disruption, I am able to compromise and provide the time and energy that is takes to develop a successful relationship.

I'm not perfect and still have much growing to do. But I'd rather focus on that exploration in the company of another.

If you'd care for a brief description, I'm 51, white, openly gay, masculine, hairy, couple of tattoos, goatee, buzzed head. I'm 5'8", 185#. I have three cats and two aquariums. I enjoy swimming and biking, reading, gardening, movies and music, road trips, geography, astronomy and photography. I'm an educated professional, good communicator, very passionate and sexually versatile. I'm also HIV negative and STD free.

I'm looking for men within approx 5-10 years of my age, masculine, openly gay, white or Latin, stable, know what manners are and exercise them daily, don't count the gym as a hobby or activity, are DDF, non smokers, no pet allergies, and who are assertive as far as communication goes.

I'm seeking a real romantic interpersonal connection...if that ends up leading to physical intimacy, great. If not, that's totally fine too. 

I'm married BUT I'm in an open platonic marriage with my wife of nearly 16 years who came out as asexual last year. Basically at this point we're like really close friends who love one another and share property who built a nice life together. We're looking for someone special to eventually share in that life together depending on how things develop.

I was touched and it really put my mind at ease.

title: older man seeks UCSC/Cabrillo undergrad
text:
Welcome. Thanks for opening my ad.

You are already weird in a nice way since you're looking at Craigslist ads (yes, people really did used to meet this way!) in a most retro fashion. I'd have expected you to be glued to Facebook, Tinder, Instagram, or some other smartphone app, and not to have much time for old-fashioned words typed on a screen.

But, apart from your willingness to meet someone via CL, or at least be entertained by the ads (hopefully you are not just doing a research project), just how weird are you?

Namely, did you notice the "51" that was also part of my ad? Yes, I am more than twice your age. I suspect you didn't notice that, so there's your warning not to read further.

Indeed, I want a friendship, and hopefully sexual relationship, with someone "scandalously" younger. What can I say: I love Nabokov; I love being a teacher as well as a student, I'd like to find a muse or a mentor as well as being one; I think power disparities (youth and beauty vs. "wisdom") are fascinating; I think a relationship that is a conspiracy a deux and that everyone else in the world disapproves of is hot.

The odds of finding this are minimal, I know. But, I've corresponded enough with those your age to know there are girls who share the dream. Especially, for some reason, at UCSC. (There's something about slugs -- ha!) 

One or two I came close to meeting, but for those particular individuals I failed the looks test (damn digital cameras!). I think I'm not bad-looking, and I have a nice smile; I'm tall (6' 2 1/2") and have blue eyes and shaggy brown hair. That said, you're dealing with a character actor, not a leading man, so to speak ...

I'm a writer, editor, and photographer, and most interested in hanging out with an artistic or musical girl. Scientists can be sexy too, and anyhow beggars like me can't be choosers, so just bring what you have.

I grew up almost friendless and being called queer throughout school. I didn't have any relationships at all until I was older than you are. Late bloomer. 

Now, I'm boringly hetero (though adventurous within that -- I don't like conventional sex roles and stereotypes) but certainly queer-friendly. I do have a bi woman friend who'd play with us both and is much closer to your age, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.

I madly love most types of music, though leaning more toward classical, trad jazz, some classic rock, lots of woman singer-songwriters, Sinatra and the rat pack. 

I like good beer and cocktails, plus single-malt whiskies, though at the moment I'm enduring a low carb diet (sigh). Good weed is an occasional pleasure, though a lot less than I used to. I'd also try molly -- or whatever they're calling it these days -- again if I knew it was legit. But, I'd rather enhance my life by looking at you and listening to your voice than via chemicals.

I'm not sure what to add, given that likely I'm whistling in the wind anyhow. But just in case I'm also whispering in your ear, well, I'll post this and perhaps refine it later.

I expect replies from the auto-spammers, as well as from the brigade of immature guys who like to pose as girls and fuck with people who dared to put their head up above the parapet and post something a little different. Sadly that's the way of CL these days.

So, no offense, but if you respond, I'll expect you to prove that you're really a girl by attaching some fresh photos that are real, not ripped from someone else's FB profile or whatever! Or, you can record a voice message for me and attach it to your message. Whatever you like.

If you'd like to make my heart leap happily, use the subject line "It sounds like you might be describing me."

Cheers!
