title: Why is Romance Miscellaneous?
text:
You get to learn quite a bit about people in the way in which they post their personals ads. Most of these ads tell you what the other person is looking for, but not what they have to offer. But isn't that REALLY what this format is about?

I'm a middle aged white male, considered handsome by some, reasonably fit and in good health. At this point in my life, I'm pointing my gaze inward and asking myself not what I want from a relationship, but what I can offer. I can provide stability, consistency and a nurturing disposition. I own my own home, have a good job, a few good friends, and am close to my family. I can provide a warm fuzzy chest to lay your head or a pair of strong hands to massage those kinks out of your shoulders. I can provide compassion during the hard times and lot of laughter during the good.

This is not to say that I don't have my own needs and desires, but we can discuss those in person. I will say this, however. The one quality that is essential for you to possess is stability -- that you are grounded in all parts of your life. While I'm not looking for a lot of disruption, I am able to compromise and provide the time and energy that is takes to develop a successful relationship.

I'm not perfect and still have much growing to do. But I'd rather focus on that exploration in the company of another.

If you'd care for a brief description, I'm 51, white, openly gay, masculine, hairy, couple of tattoos, goatee, buzzed head. I'm 5'8", 185#. I have three cats and two aquariums. I enjoy swimming and biking, reading, gardening, movies and music, road trips, geography, astronomy and photography. I'm an educated professional, good communicator, very passionate and sexually versatile. I'm also HIV negative and STD free.

I'm looking for men within approx 5-10 years of my age, masculine, openly gay, white or Latin, stable, know what manners are and exercise them daily, don't count the gym as a hobby or activity, are DDF, non smokers, no pet allergies, and who are assertive as far as communication goes.

title: Mature Woman Desired (45 to 75) For Discreet Friendship
text:
I'm not looking for just a casual encounter, nor a platonic one. I'm really seeking to connect with someone for a discreet long term relationship/friendship.

This may be a long shot, but I'm putting it out in the universe.

First of all, don't think that you're competing against a crowd of other women here, so don't hesitate to reply. I expect, at best, only a rarefied few to be in my age range and with a true interest and capacity in building such a relationship. And I promise that I will get back to you. The Internet can sometimes be a cold, isolating place. And I want to change that. 

Okay... now for full disclosure:
I'm 65 years old and married to a wonderful wife who, as all too many our age, is succumbing to old age. I thought passion would last forever. It didn't. I have gradually lost my passionate lover, hiking buddy, flea market companion, and all-around playmate. She still has her warmth, and her charm, so we are very close, and I am committed to enjoying life with her forever. 

I'm not looking to change my relationship status, nor yours. That said, I'm not old, not hardly, and, unlike my friends and acquaintances, I will not go gently into that good senior night. I've even checked out a local senior center, to hopefully meet and connect with a warm and passionate woman my age, only to feel that I am probably taking on an impossible quest.

Oddly, being fit and physically active, I am sometimes hit up on by women almost half my age. But I need an emotional connection that can only be met with a woman, who is also reasonably fit and active, and in my age range.

Your race is not important here. 

I am 5'11" tall, Caucasian, politically conservative, active, educated and handsome, and retired, with a fun, part time job. I live in the Oakland area and have grown children (out the house). I rarely drink, don't smoke, and I don't use recreational drugs (but I won't hold you to the same standards). And I am confident that you will not be disappointed.

I've received enough hate mail from this post, from those of you (who will probably never find intimacy anyway) who think that what I'm doing is wrong. Please keep your harsh and ugly comments to yourself. And stop brooding and resenting those of us who seek out excitement and romance in our lives.

Although we BabyBoomers like to believe otherwise, sobering clinical research bares out that women 60 years and older:
- 54% have lost all interest in sex. 
- 36% have a libido so low that it can scarcely be said to exist. 
I'm seeking out that rarefied 10%, who still burn with desire.

We do live in a parallel universe: 
One universe is the mainstream world that we've all familiar with since childhood, the open and highly visible society of order, civility, family and religion.

Welcome to the "other universe:" A time-honored hidden world in the shadows, where infidelity, lust and desire run their course, to fix and heal things that are not quite right in the first universe, and in a discreet and socially acceptable manner.

I can understand the many reasons why you may be hesitant to respond to my post:

Reason 1: I'm married (duh!).

Reason 2: You're married, or in a committed relationship, or simply "... curious and just browsing... " or you're being a bad girl and just might want to do something about it.

Reason 3: You think you're somehow unattractive and undesirable.

Reason 4: You have a deep, embarrassing, unspeakable handicap, a disease, or some sort of senior impairment, and somehow feel unworthy because of this.

Reason 5: You are reluctant to delve into that erotic underbelly of society (think CraigsList), where passions, needs and desires are satisfied.

Reason 6: You have the need for someone to be intimate with, but simply don't have the time, nor the interest for the demands of a full time relationship.

Reason 7: At your age you're now trying to get into Heaven, in earnest.


In answer to #1 and #2: "How come the best men are all married?!" a female co-worker exclaimed. And I've observed the same can sometimes apply to women.

#3 and #4: Do not feel that you are somehow unworthy. I've have always found women, my age and older, to be both interesting and attractive. Their strengths and shortcomings add depth to their personality and character. 

#5: Having butterflies in your stomach about all of this is completely normal, and part of the "rush" and exhilaration of the experience. It's your body telling you that your spirit is still alive inside you. But such ecstasy certainly won't happen if you don't take the plunge.

#6: This also sums up my situation. 

And as for reason #7: How long do you think you have left on this planet? 5 years... 10 years... err, uh... 15 years? Really? Believe me: Those online Life Expectancy Calculators are wildly optimistic, and intentionally misleading. And do you honestly think that you'll retain your sharp mental faculties, and passions, to the very end?
I ask you to think about this: If the last 10 or 20 years are any indication, those remaining years will pass by rather quickly. And do you truly feel that there is no excitement and romance left in your life? When confronted with our ultimate destiny, some will virtuously react with fervent prayer. While others will choose to pop open the champagne and gleefully celebrate like there's no tomorrow.
Which one are you?

And how far am I willing to bend to find the right woman in this unlikely age group?

I have thought a great deal about this and am ready to make true compromises.

Hmmm... let me go ahead and say it all:

It's okay if you wear dentures, have wrinkles, gray or white hair (or bald), sagging breasts, small breasts, partial or full mastectomy, large thighs, partial or full hysterectomy, overweight (think Rubenesque), physical handicap, varicose veins, hemorrhoids, or an incurable disease, no college education, you for some reason consider yourself unattractive, wear senior clothes, or wear adult diapers (okay... I'll have to think a little more about these last two). 
All of these can be completely irrelevant, with the woman who radiates true warmth, passion and desire.

In your response to this ad, you do not have to provide a photo, nor your name, as there will be plenty of opportunity for personal exchanges after both of us feel that there is a connection. We must both discover a physical and emotional attraction. I want to be able to enjoy you, make you feel good.

Feel free to spell out any special needs and desires. This may the appropriate opportunity, while incognito, to tell me any of your deep, embarrassing, unspeakable handicaps, and get it off your chest. Really. You'll feel much better and relaxed after full disclosure. And I will get back to you, and very likely tell you that your very private concerns are okay.

After both of us develop an interest we can exchange photos and meet in a public place for coffee.

Daytime flexibility would be ideal for me, with occasional late evenings, and even some overnights. We can develop and nurture a rewarding relationship with our precious time: Express our affection for each other, exchange regular and intimate emails, with fun meetings at local coffee shops.

I promise that you will be rewarded with forbidden fruit: A fit and viral man, who will make you smile and warm your heart.

I am very active in the community. Having many projects and interests, I have a large Internet/international following, of which I can email you the fun and interesting links, after we meet. You are also invited to join me in any of my local group activities and causes, especially if you're looking to meet new people.

Even at my age I truly feel that life still has much in store for me. I'm looking for someone who wants to share in that excitement and adventure, someone I can communicate feelings and ideas with on a normal basis.

But you can be certain that nothing at all will happen in your remaining years until you reach out and connect with someone.

title: Youthful Older Woman Seeking Same
text:
Since I was young, I have admired older women who took such good care of themselves that their skin is smooth, they are limber, and lithe, they have beautiful smiles, light in their eyes, and they are very active. They have aura of youthfulness that defies their chronological age by decades. Now that I am one of them, at age 58, I still wish to be with one; or, perhaps, now, I should say another one. 

My life is filled with work, yoga, meditation, spiritual practice, dance, music, education, and professional research. I have a very broad range of interests, and the drive to be more than superficially engaged with most of them; (still haven't moved ahead on that adolescent interest in having a chinchilla farm, yet.) It's nice to see many more posts from other transwomen on CL; I am one too. Ethnically, I am a mixed bag of mostly non-European lineage, with dark skin. I am tall, and thin. Pretty; "beautiful", "gorgeous" are the two most common words I hear people using to describe me. 

Generally, I am very chill; I don't like drama, or drama queens. My general temperament is melancholy; that deep artist muse thing. I prefer to stay indoors, and do things that cultivate the mind, and spirit, or just to work, rather than go walking in any crowded area, just to be around other people. When going out, I like to go walking, dancing, heading in any given direction, and discovering what's to be discovered. Very sensual. I like adventure; I like making adventures with my friends. 

A few preferences:
Movies: Action, Thriller, rather than chick flix. 
Books: Well, let's just say that my idea of a home library is the Library of Congress. 
People: Honest. Conscious. Sensitive. Holy, (not religious). 
Music: Acoustic, (Classical, Folk, Celtic, World); Electronic, (Trance, Vocal Trance, Downtempo); Jazz; I don't like R&B, Rap, or Hip Hop. 
Animation: Old school! 
Television: PBS 
Drink: Water.
Pet preference: Cat


Looking At Her Through My Lens

Self identity is very important to me in a partner. If being intimate with someone, I need her to really know herself!! I am totally disinterested in a wishy-washy, weak, needy, clingy woman, or a codependent relationship with anyone. My desired partner is a strong woman, with a soft, gentle exterior. She is a professional woman, and has had a career being steadily self-supportive. She is slender, to thin, and in good general health; i.e. she has a well-tuned yoga, or pilates body. [Good general health above age 55 is a relative reality; I get that.] 

My partner is broadly interested too; in topics, and people. She is tech saavy, and doesn't have a problem with using email, or text, or any other digital means of communication. She knows how not to hurt with her words. She is very creative, perhaps even a professional artist of some sort. She has a meditation practice, and she understands things like shamanism, mysticism, and weird, fringe stuff. She is magical. She is definitely not a morning person. 

[Most of my friends here are in their 30s, because they thought I am within 5 years of their age group when we met, and liked each other--when they were in their 20s, and I was in my 40's. Likewise,] most of her friends are a generation younger than her chronological age, for the same reason. She doesn't dye her hair; gray is beautiful. She is not judgemental. She likes to laugh, and to make her partner laugh. She lives independently, (preferably in San Francisco, or within 10 miles of the City's land borders), with little to no significant financial challenges, and is very liberal in her politics, and not religious in her spirituality. She has fully grasped her post-menopausal power, she likes being on top, and her life path is mainly focused on representing Love, and the Divine Feminine. 

Are you her?


How To Reach Me

Use words; communicate. In personal, intimate relationships, I do not accept ambiguity about thoughts, feelings, needs, desires, preferences, peeves, or anything else that requires mutual understanding. Emotions? Abundant here, and I know how to talk about them, so you must be very comfortable doing so too; without enabling fear to prevail over Love. I am not here to intuit that information from you, or to pull it out of you; you've got to like to be understood by your words too, and to be very good at enabling people to do so. For starters, that's all; now, talk to me, and make me interested, in you--topic of conversation is up to you. :-)


Final clarification: I am posting for women who [for example] are in their 60s, but whom everyone who guesses their age puts them in their 40. If in her 50s, they place her in her 30s. If in her 70s, or 80s, they place her in her 50s, or 60s. I am uncomfortable going through the motions of communicating to a responder, only to find out that she looks her actual chronogical age +/- 3-4 years. Honesty is at the top of my priority list. Be honest with me by being honest with yourself; there is NOTHING wrong with appearing to be your actual chronological age; no deficit, no bad, however, it is not okay to imply that you do not appear to be so when approaching someone who, in this context, is specifically seeking someone who does not appear to be so. This about more than appearance; it is about a level of corporeal vibration, down to the cellular level--I wish to be with an older woman who appears to be, and lives in the higher, general, physical vibratory state that is more common among women who are a generation younger, relative to activity level, open-mindedness, and physical appearance. If any of those three factors are not present, please do not present yourself to me; in the words of Peter Pan, and Captain Hook, that's just not good form. 

Best of success to you in finding loving, supportive, non-harmful companionship.
______________________________________

title: A Streetcar Named Admire
text:
What Tenn Thought of My Bedroom 

age: 68

On a foggy eve in the fall of '80, I caught a glimpse of Tennessee Wms. under-reaching for a bottle of gin off a shelf at a liquor store on Geary Blvd. Dressed in the habiliment of a 19th century Greek mariner (curly-hair wig and all), I was rapidly trotting to a disco on Polk St. Sans much consideration, I went to him, and handed him the bottle. "No need to thank the kindness of this stranger", or something else of that corny ilk I uttered to him. He was taken aback timidly by my "high" countenance & out-of-place costume. We sallied while he shopped and paid for snacks. I asked if I could walk with him to his destination, Colony Hotel. Upon reaching the foyer, he asked if I would visit with him. Lying to him, I stated that I was on my way home to feed "Mugger", my golden retriever.

When Ten Ten and I entered my cottage, I showed him to a seetee and later handed him a highball glass with ice. He inquired where the spiral staircase led to; I responded, "to the ballroom." "Ballroom? May I see it?" I toured him into my inordinately decorated bedroom, alight with five honey-wax candles in glass and wooden lanterns that cast arabesque silhouettes against the carroty bamboo ceiling. The ersatz tapestries (thumb-nailed quilts) quivered in the cross-breezes as we heard Muddy Waters' blues emanating from a neighboring cafe. He raised his eyes to look upon an embalmed Sicilian owl and Caucasian mouse perching on a rosemary branch above my German-made bed. Tenn was further roused by the scent of blooming orchids I cultivated on a portable fountain on the deck overlooking the steeples of twin churches.

He seemed nostalgically transported; closing his eyes and dilating his nares, he came closer to me and said he felt akin to being in the presence of the Moon Lake Casino. He asked to lie serenely next to me and experience pillow talk between us.

No longer am I this quixotic lad, neither are you a gallant poet. Nevertheless, I pine to be visited by a very mature "man of letters"; a gent steeped in sublime sensuousness with whom I can explore The Arts, intimate conversation, and perhaps physical expression. Tennessee gave me hours of delight. The other side of joy is that it is too frequently followed by crawling periods of grief over what is lost.

title: OUT OF TOWN MAN SEEKS FRIENDSHIP WITH A NICE WOMAN IN THE BAY AREA
text:
Hello
Thanks for being curious enough to open my ad and hopefully you are the woman I am seeking to have a certain type of friendship with, which I will explain below.

I'm from out of town and I occasionally travel to the San Francisco Bay area on jobs that I do in the general area and this happens randomly so there's no set schedule. My job could be anywhere in or around the Bay area depending on where my job takes me. Because of the driving time involved with my job I often end up having to seek a motel room somewhere just to get a shower and some rest and I would then be on my way the next day.

When I'm in that situation of having worked all day and being tired I often wonder if only I knew of a nice friendly woman friend that lived in the area that I could come stay with for the night, take a shower and perhaps a nap and later on take my nice friend out for dinner or maybe breakfast as a way to say thanks and to keep each other company while being together. The thing about trying to stay in some motel is that they don't always have a vacancy or the ones that do are usually very expensive especially if all I really need is a shower and a bed to sleep in for the night. It is also lonely with nobody to talk to as well. It would be very nice if I always had a nice friend that would always be happy to have me stay with her for the night and keep her company on the random occasions that I travel to the Bay area.

I would also be happy to help out around the home once I had some rest, either later that evening or in the morning. It would not matter what you would need help with as long as I am capable of doing it properly and I am fairly handy with some things being that I'm mechanically inclined. I can do some cooking as well if you would like, kind of basic with that, not to complicated anyway. I like doing stir fry sometimes as well. Or I could offer a small payment for my stay if you would prefer that. I am also open to other suggestions if it is helpful to you in some way and of course as long as it is something I can do for you even if it is something unusual... well it has to be legal at least. lol

A little about me now... I am a white male that is in his mid 50's, I have a stocky build and I'm a little heavy set and trying to lose the extra weight. I'm just under 6' tall, brown hair, clean shaven and no tattoos. I am a friendly and caring person. I am honest and respectful and I try to be helpful to my friends. I am open minded and considerate and I am easy going. I am reasonable and fair minded in my thinking. I do not take drugs and never have, it's not the smart thing to do. I do not smoke and I never have and it's simply not good for you in many ways. And I do not really drink although I rarely have a small amount of red wine. I would only want to be around someone who does not smoke, use drugs and does not drink or not too much anyway. I need to also mention that I am married but my marriage is not a happy one unfortunately so please be ok or comfortable with that fact if you would be interested in contacting me. I do not carry any diseases and I try to eat healthy. Other things about myself is that I like to talk about almost anything and being open minded makes the conversation more interesting but I tend to stick with what is based on truth or of reasonable thought and possibilities for the purposes of speculation.

The type of woman I would love to have as my friend is someone that is very friendly and accommodating with a caring and genuine personality. A honest woman that can easily communicate her thoughts and feelings and be up front about things. A woman who enjoys laughter and being silly sometimes. A woman that has an easy going and friendly attitude and is open minded. Any race of woman is fine. Must be at least 18 years old but I prefer a woman from mid 20's to mid 40's but I am open to other ages. A woman that is not a drug user or a smoker and keeps her home more on the tidy side than not but I can help clean up things if help is needed of course.

I'm hoping that I eventually have such a woman respond to my ad so we can get to know each other by email messages and talking by phone or maybe texting sometimes. I would be happy to give more information about myself and the type of work I do that brings me into the Bay area on random occasions. We can also exchange our photos if things progress in a positive way between us. Again this friendship would be so we can both help each other out as friends as previously mentioned and to enjoy each others company beyond that, sharing good conversations and laughter and just enjoying each others company and for anything else that may naturally come about while I am visiting you which could be something intimate if we both want things to go that way but there should be a foundation of friendship in any case whatever may happen. 
The general areas of the San Francisco Bay area that I would not mind traveling to in order to stay overnight with a new friend would be anywhere from San Francisco to the San Jose area and Richmond or Concord to the San Jose area and as far south as Gilroy and from Hayward to Tracy and pretty much anywhere between all of those areas. So you can see that's a rather large area but my ideal areas to find a new friend would be around the Dublin to Hayward areas but that is only a preference of course and mainly this choice would probably work better as a central place to hang out and rest after my job is done. But if you are anywhere else in the general area as mentioned and are interested then please respond.
If you are the woman that I am seeking and would love to make a new friend that could visit you every once in awhile and are curious to explore what could possibly be a real friendship then I invite your response and I would love to hear from you and to know your thoughts and your feelings about my offer. I would like to make sure that I am only going to open real responses so if you would please put in the subject line of your email the words OUT OF TOWN MAN and I'll figure that it's from a real person responding to my ad which will be opened and read instead of being deleted.

Thanks very much for your time and if my ad is not right for you then I wish you well in what you are searching for.

Totally laid back, this beer and wine lounge is the perfect place to hang out. 
Come alone or with friends you're sure to have a great time! 

Our attentive and knowledgeable bartenders are always happy to help you find that perfect wine for your palate, without any commercial "spin" or arrogant pretense. Our goals are to share and spread wine appreciation while putting a cork in wine snobbery.

Our Beers on tap include SF's own Anchor Steam, Mendocino's original craft beer Eye of the Hawk (only at 3 locations in SF!), and the East Coast Favorite 90 min IPA Dogfish Head. 

We have three flat screen TVs that you can watch while enjoying our extensive beer and wine selection. With some of the best prices in town and awesome atmosphere, The Pour House can't be beat!

Come enjoy craft brews, fine wines, and a relaxing atmosphere with Polk Street's favorite beer & wine bar. Feel free to lounge on our comfy couches or tap your feet to our tunes. Parties free of charge! Located at 1327 Polk st. For more info please contact me, Liam. 

Liam at sfpourhouse
